results.content: There is not really an explanation of anything. The code is already there and the instructor basically just reads the code without explaining what anything actually does.

results.content: The course is fine.  Captions help to a degree, but at least for me as a speaker of an American variant of English, I found the course instructor's accent difficult to follow.  The early examples also didn't contribute much, as the work was done for you in downloaded files (rather than being something truly hands on that you build as part of learning how to do basic set up).

response.content:
Thanks for your feedback Rebecca, I'm currently working on my accent and the early examples were not meant to teach you how to build extensions but to get a little familiar with the process as a complete beginner (every part of the code is explained in details in the following section). I've not uploaded the complete coding process just to avoid making it longer.
Sorry for any inconvenience you have faced. I'll update the videos soon with a better accent and more engaging content and more professional audio so, please stay tuned.

results.content: Great and very informative course .. I love how you are going directly to the point and how you about delivering the information .. I was looking for a course to learn google chrome exrenstions development but most of the courses I've found out there are not actually focusing on extensions development nstead they are barely scratching the surface and focusing mainly on html and js which is not what I came here for.

response.content: Thanks for your words Tho, Glad you like it.
